com.java.calumjohnston.algorithms

Class LSB

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.java.calumjohnston.algorithms.LSB

  • public class LSB
extends java.lang.Object
    The LSB class performs LSB encoding and decoding on images

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage encode(java.awt.image.BufferedImage coverImage,
                                           java.lang.String text,
                                           boolean red,
                                           boolean green,
                                           boolean blue,
                                           boolean random,
                                           java.lang.String seed)
        Performs the LSB encoding algorithm - Detailed in lsb.txt
        Parameters:
        coverImage - Image to be used (acting as the Cover)
        text - Data to be inserted (acting as the Payload)
        red - Determines whether the red colour channel will be used
        green - Determines whether the blue colour channel will be used
        blue - Determines whether the green colour channel will be used
        random - Determines whether the PRNG will be used
        seed - Acts as the seed for the PRNG
        Returns:
        Image with data hidden within it (acting as the Stego Image)

      • encodeParameters

        public void encodeParameters(java.awt.image.BufferedImage coverImage,
                             boolean random,
                             int[] coloursToConsider,
                             boolean red,
                             boolean green,
                             boolean blue,
                             int[] finalValues)
        Gets all the parameters and stores them with their corresponding number of bits required to store
        Parameters:
        coverImage - The image to be used
        random - Determines whether the PRNG will be used
        coloursToConsider - List of colours we will encode data into
        red - Boolean to whether red will be used
        green - Boolean to whether green will be used
        blue - Boolean to whether blue will be used
        finalValues - Tuple storing final insertion parameters

      • encodeData

        public int[] encodeData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage coverImage,
                        java.lang.StringBuilder binary,
                        int[] coloursToConsider,
                        java.lang.String dataType,
                        boolean random)
        Encodes the stream of binary data into the cover Image
        Parameters:
        coverImage - Image to be used
        binary - Binary data to be encoded
        coloursToConsider - List of colours we will encode data into
        dataType - Defines the type of data being embedded
        random - Determines
        Returns:
        Tuple storing final insertion parameters

      • getStartingPosition

        public int[] getStartingPosition(java.awt.image.BufferedImage coverImage,
                                 boolean random,
                                 java.lang.String dataType,
                                 int[] coloursToConsider)
        Gets the position to start encoding data from (in encodeData() method)
        Parameters:
        coverImage - The image to be used
        random - Determines whether the PRNG is used
        dataType - Defines the type of data being inserted
        coloursToConsider - List of colours we will encode data into
        Returns:
        The starting position

      • generateNextPosition

        public int[] generateNextPosition(int imageWidth,
                                  int[] currentPosition,
                                  boolean random)
        Generates next position in image to encode data into
        Parameters:
        imageWidth - The width of the image being used
        currentPosition - The position which data has just been encoded
        random - Determines whether random embedding should be used
        Returns:
        The new position to consider

      • getPixelData

        public int[] getPixelData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage coverImage,
                          int x,
                          int y)
        Gets pixel data from an image at a specific location
        Parameters:
        coverImage - Image to be used
        x - x coordinate of pixel
        y - y coordinate of pixel
        Returns:
        Tuple of RGB values (representing the pixel)

      • insertLSB

        public int insertLSB(int colour,
                     char data)
        Inserts data into pixel data (by LSB technique)
        Parameters:
        colour - Original colour to be manipulated
        data - Data to be inserted
        Returns:
        Updated colur

      • writePixelData

                           int[] pixelData,
                           int x,

        Writes pixel data to an image at a specific location
        Parameters:
        coverImage - Image to be used
        pixelData - Typle of RGB values (representing the pixel)
        x - x coordinate of pixel
        y - y coordinate of pixel

        Converts input text into binary equivalent
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Binary Equivalent of ASCII text

      • getBinaryParameters

        public java.lang.String getBinaryParameters(int parameter,
                                            int parameter_length)
        Converts input parameter into binary equivalent
        Parameters:
        parameter - Parameter to be converted
        parameter_length - Required length of parameter (in bits)
        Returns:
        The binary equivalent of the input parameter (correct to number of bits)

      • getColoursToConsider

        public int[] getColoursToConsider(boolean red,
                                  boolean green,
                                  boolean blue)
        Gets the colours that will be used
        Parameters:
        red - Boolean to whether red will be used
        green - Boolean to whether green will be used
        blue - Boolean to whether blue will be used
        Returns:
        An int[] array storing only the colours it considers

      • decode

        public java.lang.String decode(java.awt.image.BufferedImage stegoImage,
                               java.lang.String seed)
        Performs the LSB decoding algorithm (detailed in LSB.txt)
        Parameters:
        stegoImage - Image to be used
        seed - Seed used to initialise PRNG
        Returns:
        Text hidden within the image

      • getColourParameter

        public boolean getColourParameter(int colour)
        Determines whether an LSB is 1 or 0
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour whose LSB will be used
        Returns:
        False = 0; True = 1;

      • getParameterData

        public int[] getParameterData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage stegoImage,
                              boolean random,
                              int[] coloursToConsider)
        Gets the parameter data from the stego image
        Parameters:
        stegoImage - Image to be used
        random - Determines whether random embedding was used
        coloursToConsider - List of colours that data was embedded into
        Returns:
        Tuple of data storing parameter values

      • getParameterBinary

        public java.lang.String getParameterBinary(java.awt.image.BufferedImage stegoImage,
                                           int reserved_length,
                                           boolean random,
                                           int[] coloursToConsider,
                                           java.lang.String dataType)
        Gets the binary equivalent of the parameters needed for decoding
        Parameters:
        stegoImage - Image to be used
        reserved_length - Total bit length of parameters to be retrieved
        random - Determines whether random embedding was used
        coloursToConsider - List of colours that data was embedded into
        dataType - Defines the type of data being retrieved
        Returns:
        String parameter (in binary)

      • getDecodeStartingPosition

        public int[] getDecodeStartingPosition(java.awt.image.BufferedImage stegoImage,
                                       boolean random,
                                       int[] coloursToConsider,
                                       java.lang.String dataType)
        Gets the position to start decoding data from (HOPEFULLY USE ONE FUNCTION FOR ENCODING AND DECODING EVENTUALLY!!)
        Parameters:
        stegoImage - The image to be used
        random - Determines whether random embedding was used
        coloursToConsider - List of colours that data was embedded into
        dataType - Defines the type of data being retrieved
        Returns:
        Position to start decoding (dependent on what we're decoding)

      • getHiddenData

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getHiddenData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage stegoImage,
                                             boolean random,
                                             int[] coloursToConsider,
                                             int[] parameters)
        Gets the binary equivalent of the hidden data in the image
        Parameters:
        stegoImage - The image to be used
        random - Determines whether random embedding was used
        coloursToConsider - List of colours that data was embedded into
        parameters - List of parameters used for determining when to stop decoding
        Returns:
        The text hidden within the image

      • getText

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getText(java.lang.StringBuilder binaryText)
        Converts the binary stream of data to it's ASCII equivalent
        Parameters:
        binaryText - Binary stream of data
        Returns:
        ASCII representation of binary data
